Content: @ComputerGenie ğŸ‘´ğŸ¼ğŸ“¢ you just need to place the 2 routers into the same network, with the same netmask, like 192.168.0.0/24 ... but you will have to disable the DHCP-servers on router1 and router2 and configure one on router3, so you have only one DHCP in your network and not 2 or 3
